pros: good to work here. nice place

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Chicago, IL
pros: Most people come here to start there careers then leave as soon as possible
cons: High turnover rate here. Management does not care

pros: Some great staff to work with that make a huge difference.
cons: Management is not a strongpoint.

review_title: Don't do it. Will low ball you.
job_title: Clinical Staff Pharmacist in Chicago, IL
pros: The people (outside of administration) are great. It is a family there. Everyone works together in unity there is a sense of belonging. It is a good place for a starting point in your career to get experience but management does not care about you at all. Patient care is not safe with staff issues. Place really needs to be shut down.
cons:
Management/Administration (not pharmacy director or pharmacy tech director; referring to administration above them).
No one is getting paid anywhere near what they should (it is significantly below what local employers offer) and every department is severely under staffed. Look at the careers / job posting listed on their website. It is astronomical. Because of the understaffing and underpaying, the place works people to death and asks for people to continue giving their all until there is nothing left to give. Patient care is not safe with staff issues. Place really needs to be shut down.

job_title: Licensed Clinical Therapist in Chicago, IL
pros: Great PTO policy for salaried workers. Friendly coworkers.
cons: Not a lot of room to advance, low budgets for departments.

pros: PTO not bad and respiratory superior is nice
cons: Their pay rate is one of the lowest in Chicago land area. Most of this RT's left the building. They don't give you annual raise. You will be working short staff every single day and you will be working with Bunch of agency people so don't expect any team work. If you are a respiratory therapist please stay away from this establishment. The management don't appreciate the work you do for them.

pros: Good salary, benefits are ok, free parking,
cons: Management and behavioral health has high turnover rates! Mgmt doesn't communicate with staff,, leave you in the dark then blind side you with unit closure! Bad area

pros: Great Staff - all were friendly and helpful. Great Benefits!
cons: pay could have been better

pros: There are no pros. Everything here is bad.
cons: Management takes advantage of employees. Bully/guilt you into extra shifts. No raises and no Christmas bonuses. Didn’t even do anything for nurses week during Covid. No crisis pay and were forced to use reusable gowns. Re-sterilizing n95. Also stocked unapproved n95

review_title: Please do not waste your time with this organization.

review_title: good place to start if your trying to get your foot in the door

review_title: Make the best out of nothing
pros: Coworkers and the environment makes it feel like a family. Great place to learn.
cons: Lack of resources, clientele wears you down, constant change in management, Lack of leadership.

pros: Community involvement is very present
cons: Commute no WFH offered to admin employees

pros: The place is not busy & the community the hospital serves is low maintenance.
cons: staff have low moral, thanks to management! No sense of professionalism by management. Employee satisfaction means nothing to the hospital & negative behaviors are rewarded. There is a huge problem with favoritism & therefore you have people competing towards each other to get the fabulous role of unit snitch. Corruption defines NAH! Do not expect to get salary raises every year & if you do get a raise, the amount is a joke. The environment is not only negative and draining emotionally, but it is physically DIRTY. Leaking roofs & God know what kind of mold grows there because the hospital smells very musty.

pros: Inexpensive food, some staff genuinely care about the community they serve, clean facilities. Good life lesson opportunity to experience a terrible work culture once in your life.
cons:
Terrible culture, outdated processes, toxic, toxic, toxic. There is low morale and no accountability by management. This job will make you realize that ANY other job you've ever had in your entire life is better than this.
This organization will not only stunt growth, but also management lacks common decency of respecting another human being, gossips and are very unprofessional. Staff that are very passionate will soon be dampened by the negativity showered on them on a daily basis. VERY HOSTILE work environment.

pros: Hard working, caring staff.  Small community feel where everyone supports each other like family.  Mission driven organization willing to take care of anyone who needs help and ensure everyone has access to quality health care.  Experienced and caring management team focused on quality and patient safety. Working hard to improve patient and employee satisfaction.
cons: Turnover in management.  Very dependent financially on state and federal funding puts very strict limits and strain on finances.

pros: NAH is a great place to work. We serve indigent patients. My reason for working here is to be part of a change and improve things we do.  There are some great talented people working here in all areas and we all learn from each other.
cons: Every place has cons. We should focus on  good things we do and stay positive.

review_title: Small community hospital with potential and room for improvement.
pros: Culture, small, community-based, growth and development opportunities...
cons: Terrible pay, short staffed, high turnover, easy to burn out...

review_title: The nurse managers and supervisors are deplorable.
pros: Serving the people from the community and my immediate Co workers are like family.
cons:
The present management is extremely terrible and not looking for positive change.
They treat staff nurses awful.
